attributes.action: request that the football league DO NOT remove the 15-point deduction from Leeds United AFC
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In response to a petition by ( Simon Lee Jackson – Deadline to sign up by: 06 May 2008 – Signatures: 17,962), this is a counter petition.

The 15 point deduction applied at the start of the 2007/8 football season is a fair and just punishment for a club, or more specifically a chairman, aiming to circumvent rules put in place to protect all fans of football, our national sport. It is not in the3 interests of sport generally as it has been done purely for financial gain.

Many local small businesses have been driven to the wall and others made to struggle all for reasons that are not sporting.

I believe this move by the football league to be wholly justified and completely fair.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
